Member Function Documentation

void landmark::Descriptor::assemble ( std::vector< cv::Point > &  contours,
int  option = (INVARIANT | DYNAMIC) 
)

Assemble descriptor.

Assemble descriptor. Given a vector of contour points (1st input), computes the descriptor parameters (output). For better performance, when necessary, compute the DYNAMIC components after the target has been detected.

Parameters
contoursthe edges points of a blob.
optionindicates which descriptor component shall be computed (invariant and/or dynamic).

Definition at line 310 of file descriptor.cpp.

void landmark::Descriptor::similarity ( Descriptor &  base,
Descriptor &  distLimits,
int &  invariant_score,
double &  dynamic_score 
)

Similarity evaluation.

Computes the similarity of two descriptors. First, the function computes the distance between the current descriptor handle and the one specified by 'base'. Then, the overall similarity score is computed based on the values specified by 'range'. If a given characteristic is within the interval defined by range, then the score is incremented. The higher the score (returning values passed as parameters), higher the similarity.

Parameters
basea descriptor containing the reference values
distLimitsa descriptor containing the maximum distance for similiraty measurements
invariant_scorethe computed score for the invariant part
dynamic_scorethe compute score for the dynamic part
